title: Life of Galileo
creator_credit: David Zweck, Daryl Wayland and Country Education Project
brief_description: Peter Couchman and Dr Ray Misson discuss the social and moral questions implied in Bertold Brecht’s play “Life of Galileo”. Shows conflict with the church and the intellectual freedom of the individual. The play also enables Brecht to comment on modern attitudes.
